ETYMOLOGY: From Old English mǣdwe ('meadow, pasturage'), from Proto-Germanic *mēdwō, related to Old English māwan ('to mow').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A piece of grassland, especially one used for hay.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一块草地，尤指用作牧草地或割草的草地。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Wildflowers dotted the expansive meadow, creating a beautiful natural tapestry.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 野花点缀着广阔的草地，形成了一幅美丽的天然画卷。
